title: Stoney Creek CIBC bank manager stole $1.7M from seniors, deceased customers: police | CBC News
text:
A bank manager at a CIBC branch in Stoney Creek is facing fraud charges, police say, after investigators say she stole nearly $2 million from seniors and customers who had recently died.

The 60-year-old Burlington woman was arrested Tuesday morning and charged with fraud over $5,000, possession over $5,000 and breach of trust, according to police.

Police say she has resigned from her position at the bank.

Hamilton police got involved on April 25 after the service says its major fraud unit received a tip from CIBC's corporate security about an internal probe alleging one of their employees had taken a large sum of money from customers.

A lengthy investigation followed and police say it found the woman stole $1.7 million between 2008 and 2015.

She was taken into custody Tuesday and released on a promise to appear in court on October 24 at 9 a.m.
